title: A behaviouristic approach to representing processes and procedures in the OASIS 2 ontology. (arXiv:2306.17514v1 [cs.AI])
abstract: Foundational ontologies devoted to the effective representation of processes and procedures are not widely investigated at present, thereby limiting the practical adoption of semantic approaches in real scenarios where the precise instructions to follow must be considered. Also, the representation ought to include how agents should carry out the actions associated with the process, whether or not agents are able to perform those actions, the possible roles played as well as the related events.  The OASIS ontology provides an established model to capture agents and their interactions but lacks means for representing processes and procedures carried out by agents. This motivates the research presented in this article, which delivers an extension of the OASIS 2 ontology to combine the capabilities for representing agents and their behaviours with the full conceptualization of processes and procedures. translated_title: 在OASIS 2本体中表示过程和程序的行为主义方法
translated_abstract: 当前对于有效表示过程和程序的基础本体不受广泛研究，从而限制了在需要考虑准确指示的实际情景中语义方法的实际采用。此外，表示应包括代理应如何执行与过程关联的操作，无论代理能否执行这些操作，以及可能发挥的角色和相关事件。OASIS本体提供了一个捕捉代理和其交互的成熟模型，但缺乏表示由代理执行的过程和程序的方法。这激发了本文中所提出的研究，其提供了OASIS 2本体的扩展，将表示代理和其行为的能力与过程和程序的完整概念化相结合。总体目标是提供一个处理代理平台、过程和程序的基础OWL本体。
tldr: 该论文提出了一种在OASIS 2本体中表示过程和程序的行为主义方法，该方法通过将代理和行为的能力与过程和程序的概念化相结合，旨在提供一个处理代理平台、过程和程序的基础OWL本体。
en_tdlr: This paper presents a behaviouristic approach to representing processes and procedures in the OASIS 2 ontology, aiming to provide a foundational OWL ontology that deals with agents, processes, and procedures by combining the capabilities for representing agent behaviours with the full conceptualization of processes and procedures.
